channel.title: Is there any way to translate mods?
channel.description: I think these mods are awesome,but English isn't my mother tongue.So I want to translate them.Could anyone give me an idea?

item.title: Is there any way to translate mods?
item.dc:creator: @isochronous Isochronous
item.description:
@isochronous wrote:

Yes. In the future, when Coffee Stain adds official mod support, that will probably include translation support for mods. So don’t be too sad, because you should be able to do this in the not-very-distant future.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there any way to translate mods?

item.title: Is there any way to translate mods?
item.dc:creator: @1112 开无双
item.description:
@1112 wrote:

Thank you.Emmm,I think it’s more difficult than what I thought before now.I have a lot of friends who love these mods.And most of them cannnot understand English well.I want to translate these mods,more is better.But I ignore that these mods aren’t made by one.
If I need to translate them,is that means I need to contact every developer?

Read full topic
item.source: Is there any way to translate mods?

item.title: Is there any way to translate mods?
item.dc:creator: @kylerhenry Kylerhenry
item.description:
@kylerhenry wrote:

The best way would be to implement the localization features in UE4.

Hooking this into existing mods without the source code however is not something I know to be possible. I would contact the mod(s) developer(s) you want to work on to see if they would be interested in localization.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there any way to translate mods?
